tool.name: CRISPR Recognition Tool
tool.command:
temp_tabular_output=\$(mktemp); java -cp \$CRISPR_RECOGNITION_TOOL_JAR_PATH/CRT1.2-CLI.jar crt -minNR $minNR -minRL $minRL -maxRL $maxRL -minSL $minSL -maxSL $maxSL #if str($searchWL) != 'none': -searchWL $searchWL #end if $input \$temp_tabular_output ;
perl \$CRISPR_RECOGNITION_TOOL_SCRIPT_PATH/format_crt_output.pl \$temp_tabular_output $output $output_region

param.name: minNR
param.label: Minimum number of repeats a CRISPER must have

param.name: minRL
param.label: Minimum length of a CRISPER repeated region

param.name: maxRL
param.label: Maximum length of a CRISPER repeated region

param.name: minSL
param.label: Minimum length of CRISPER non repeated region

param.name: maxSL
param.label: Maximum length of CRISPER non repeated region

param.name: searchWL
param.label: Length of search window to used to discover CRISPERs

tool.help:
CRISPR Recognition Tool - a tool for automatic detection of clustered regularly interspaced palindromic repeats
http://www.room220.com/crt/
**Citation**
For the underlying tool, please cite `Bland C, Ramsey TL, Sabree F, Lowe M, Brown K, Kyrpides NC, Hugenholtz P: CRISPR Recognition Tool (CRT): a tool for automatic detection of clustered regularly interspaced palindromic repeats. BMC Bioinformatics. 2007 Jun 18;8(1):209`
